intro: Valeriana martini, commonly known as the Sierra Madre valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, herbaceous foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Valeriana martini thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies for their calming effects.
